item.description:
Hey, at least it's not an Intellectual Snob event! ;)

NEW: can some one please take pictures of this & post them? (we can't, we're the busy hosts).

75 signed up between 2 groups. We have 2 hosts & may do 2 tours 10 minutes apart. One of us will stick to the times below.

THIS is a participatory tour, please tell us what you know!
We'll be asking you!

Contemporary secrets of Central Square!
Hint: if you want some historical information, go to the Central Sq. library before the meetup & you'll see some fascinating historical plaques near the main entrance.

Your hosts are 2 veteran Meetup organizers and also Central Sq. residents. 

Times & itinerary are subject to slight change:
Schedule:

3:00 PM: City Hall
3:15 PM: Rodneys Bookstore (also a very affordable gift store).
3:30 PM --Ten Thousand Villages
[Falafel Palace. a Central Sq institution]
3:50 PM: Cafe Andala
4:05 PM: Artist & Craftsman (closes at 5). Discover what "Hogwash" is (see who can find it first, let's make this a scavenger hunt!) Great supply of fake mustaches-- this is an opportunity!
4:20 PM: Dance Complex (closes at 5)-- we'll "swarm" this venue as individuals, not as a group, in order to not interrupt CLASSES! This building used to be HQ to the "Odd Fellows" lodge. Please no talking! 
(4:45 PM: a gap of 15 min's to allow people to catch up);
5:00 PM: Phoenix Landing, major stop. They have half price off their appetizers. Highly recommended= $5 fish tacos, (special ends at 7 PM sharp).
5:45 PM: Middle East, (Assignment: find the secret passageway. Yes, you can go through it, but as individuals, not as a group, to avoid interrupting waitstaff there).
6:00 PM: CCTV
6:15: Asgard Pub
6:30: Cafe Luna
6:45 PM: "Graffitti Alley"
7:00 PM: The Field patio, our last stop.
item.how_to_find_us: Near the main entrance on Mass Ave, at the foot of the stairs.
item.name: The 7 Wonders of Central Sq. Cambridge, an Unofficial Tour
